#Text=Jan van Ryen
#Text=Jan van Ryen ( fl. 1620s – 1630s ) was a 17th-century Dutch privateer , explorer , and colonist .
#Text=He was granted a commission by the Dutch West Indies Company and active against the Spanish in the West Indies during the 1620s .
#Text=He and Claude Prevost attempted to establish Dutch colonies in Guyana , although they both failed with most Dutch colonists being killed by natives in 1627 .
#Text=However , Zeelandian merchant Abraham van Peere was able to found a successful colony in the area shortly after . [ 1 ]
#Text=Biography
#Text=In November 1626 , he and Claude Prevost appeared before the Chamber of Zeeland with a proposal to establish a colony in Guyana and requesting the WIC to provide ships and 30 or 40 men .
#Text=The WIC agreed and , at separate meetings from November 23 – 26 and December 10 – 24 , the members discussed where to send them .
#Text=While it was suggested Prevost to be sent to either the Amazon , Oyapock or Essequibo , it was decided that van Ryen alone would colonize Oyapok .
#Text=On January 22 , 1627 , Jan van Ryen left Flushing with three ships and 184 men ( including 36 colonists ) .

#Text=The small fleet was commanded by Admiral Hendrick Jacobszoon Lucifer and included Galeyn van Stabels in the Vliegende Draeck and Jan Pieterse in the Leeuwin ( all three had visited the area previously , Lucifer and van Stapels having carried Captain Oudaen 's expedition to Corupa in 1625 ) .
#Text=After two months , van Ryen and his expedition arrived at their destination on March 10 .
#Text=Shortly after landing , they encountered three Europeans living in the area .
#Text=One of the men , Jan Hendricksz , had reportedly lived in the jungles for so long a time that he found it nearly impossible to speak the Dutch language .
#Text=These men claimed to be the surviving members of a Dutch colony previously established in the Amazon by a Captain Oudaen some time before .
#Text=According to Hendricksz , the colony was one of several attacked by the Spanish ( or possibly the Portuguese ) .
#Text=The Dutch fought against their attackers for half a day and forced to flee after 7 or 8 men had been killed fleeing in their longboats to a nearby English settlement where they took refuge .
#Text=However , the Spanish followed them and both the Dutch and English were forced to fight .
#Text=All the English were killed as well as many of the Dutch , including Oudaen .
#Text=Lieutenant Pieter Bruyne took command and left for the Oyapok River with 46 of the survivors , however he was killed by his sergeant in a mutiny soon after .
#Text=Quarreling amongst themselves , the men split into several groups and eventually settled among the local native tribes .
#Text=There are differing accounts of what happened to Jan van Ryen 's colony .
#Text=One account claims Jan van Ryen left the colony for the West Indies soon after their arrival and , in his absence , the Dutch colonists began fighting with the local Kalina ( Caribs ) .
#Text=They were eventually forced to abandon the colony when the situation became too dangerous for them to stay , some going to St. Vincents and Tobago . [ 2 ]
#Text=According to Dutch historian Jan Jacob Hartsinck , the settlement " did not last long " after Jan van Ryen was left behind to govern the colony .

#Text=He apparently lacked the " tact and probably fair dealing " of Jessé de Forest , who had previously attempted to found a settlement the previous year , [ 3 ] as " the savages rose against the new settlers , killed their governor ( Jan van Ryen ) , and demolished their houses " .
#Text=The survivors built several sloops with which they left the area , [ 4 ]
#Text=however only four or five were said to have survived the attack . [ 5 ]
#Text=After the colonists departure , Abraham van Peere obtained permission from the WIC to start a plantation at the nearby the Berbice River . [ 2 ]
#Text=Van Ryen appears to have found his way back to the Netherlands .
#Text=In December 1630 he registered a colony in " Quaro " with the WIC and on July 25 , 1632 , the Zeeland Chamber settled with him with respect to payment for his Oyapok expedition . [ 6 ]
#Text=After that there seems to be no record of him .
